content:
What a great idea! Getting your bike tuned up before hitting the trails is always a good idea, especially when you're venturing into unfamiliar territory. Estes Park has some excellent bike shops that can help you get your bike in top shape and provide valuable local knowledge.

Here are a few bike shops in Estes Park that come highly recommended:

1. **Estes Park Bike Shop**: This shop is located in the heart of Estes Park and offers a full range of services, including tune-ups, repairs, and rentals. They have a knowledgeable staff who can provide expert advice on local trails and conditions.
2. **Performance Bicycle**: Performance Bicycle is a well-known chain with a location in Estes Park. They offer a variety of services, including tune-ups, repairs, and custom builds. Their staff is knowledgeable about local trails and can provide guidance on where to ride.
3. **The Bike Broker**: The Bike Broker is a locally owned shop that offers tune-ups, repairs, and sales. They have a reputation for being friendly and knowledgeable about the local trails, and they can provide valuable advice on where to ride and what to expect.

All of these shops are well-regarded in the Estes Park community, and you can't go wrong with any of them. However, if you're looking for a more personalized experience, I'd recommend **Estes Park Bike Shop** or **The Bike Broker**. Both shops have a strong focus on customer service and are known for their expertise on local trails.

When you visit the shop, be sure to ask about their tune-up services and what's included. A good tune-up should include:

* Brake adjustment and cleaning
* Gear adjustment and tuning
* Chain cleaning and lubrication
* Tire pressure check and adjustment
* Quick inspection of the bike's overall condition

Additionally, don't hesitate to ask the shop staff about local trail conditions, recommendations, and any specific advice they may have for your ride. They can provide valuable insights and help you make the most of your time on the trails.

Get your bike tuned up, and you'll be ready to tackle the Rocky Mountains with confidence!
